name: deadening
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
making a feeling or a sound less painful or less strong: The doctor waited for the deadening effect of the anaesthesia to take effect. The deadening sensations had now spread to the other side of his body.
preventing new ideas from developing: She hated the deadening world of work where her managers weren't interested in new ideas. Repetition is considered to be deadening, boring, and thoughtless.
More examplesFewer examplesThe padded fabric in the studio creates a dense, deadening effect so music sounds better. Some airports try to improve the deadening experience of business travel.His school was a deadening place in which it was uncool to try too hard.
